section.heading: Favored producer of title insurer; buyer’s right to choose.

para.text: A title insurer shall not participate in any transaction in which it knows that a title insurance producer or other person requires, directly or indirectly, or through any trustee, director, officer, producer, employee, or affiliate, as a condition precedent to selling or furnishing any other person a loan, or loan extension, credit, sale, property, contract, lease, or service, that the other person shall place a title insurance policy of any kind with the title insurer or through a particular title insurance producer.
No seller of property shall require, directly or indirectly, that the buyer purchase title insurance from any particular title producer or insurer.

annotations.annotation: The 2013 amendment by DC Law 20-40 designated the existing text as (a); substituted “producer” for “agent” throughout (a); and added (b).
For temporary (90 day) addition, see § 2157 of Fiscal Year 2011 Budget Support Emergency Act of 2010 (D.C. Act 18-463, July 2, 2010, 57 DCR 6542).
